pr_title: TRUNK-5115: Replace use of conditional logging with slf4j parameterized messages

timeline.body: Logger message should be the same . It should display the both concept id and locale . With your change it will log only the locale information

timeline.body:
The log message should stay the same as correctly pointed out by @dilanthas 

In this particular case this means the change would be
```suggestion
			log.debug("there are no names defined for concept with id: {} in the locale: {}", conceptId, forLocale);
```

The example in the documentation of slf4j
http://www.slf4j.org/faq.html#logging_performance

```java
logger.debug("The new entry is "+entry+".");
logger.debug("The new entry is {}.", entry);
```

explains it well. The above two lines will lead to the same log message. Every variable like `entry` should be replaced by a placeholder `{}` inside the string (first parameter) which they call the formatting anchor. The variables that should be filled into the message by slf4j will then be passed as second, third, ... parameter.
timeline.bodyHTML:
The log message should stay the same as correctly pointed out by @dilanthas

In this particular case this means the change would be

Suggested change
log.debug("The ConceptId is {}.", conceptId);
log.debug("The Locale is" + forLocale);
log.debug("there are no names defined for concept with id: {} in the locale: {}", conceptId, forLocale);

The example in the documentation of slf4j
http://www.slf4j.org/faq.html#logging_performance

logger.debug("The new entry is "+entry+".");
logger.debug("The new entry is {}.", entry);

explains it well. The above two lines will lead to the same log message. Every variable like entry should be replaced by a placeholder {} inside the string (first parameter) which they call the formatting anchor. The variables that should be filled into the message by slf4j will then be passed as second, third, ... parameter.
timeline.author: teleivo

replies.bodyText: Thanks @ivo. Changes have been made as recommended.
